title: Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US, Lawrence Bishnoi aide claims responsibility: ‘…have avenged him’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US, Lawrence Bishnoi aide claims responsibility: ‘…have avenged him’

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Drugs smuggler Sunil Yadav was killed in a shootout in Stockton, California. He was a notorious smuggler wanted for multiple drug-related crimes in India.

  • Sunil Yadav was known to smuggle drugs into India via Pakistan.
  • He had fled to the US two years ago using a fake passport.
  • Rohit Godara claimed the killing was an act of revenge for Yadav's involvement in the death of gangster Ankit Bhadu.
  • California police and Indian authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding Yadav's death.
"He had worked with Punjab police to get our brother Ankit Bhadu killed in an encounter. We have avenged him," said Rohit Godara.

The killing marks a significant escalation in the ongoing gang conflicts that span multiple countries.
newTitle: Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US: Aide claims revenge

title: Allu Arjun At Hyderabad Police Station For Questioning In 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case - NDTV
summary:
Allu Arjun Questioned by Hyderabad Police in 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case

Date: 24 December 2024

Source: NDTV

Actor Allu Arjun is being questioned by Hyderabad Police over a deadly stampede during the screening of his film 'Pushpa 2', which resulted in the death of a young mother and critical injury to her son.

Key Points

  • Allu Arjun arrived at Chikkadpally Police Station for questioning following his interim bail in the case.
  • He was arrested last week amid controversy regarding police procedures during his arrest.
  • The High Court granted him bail, emphasizing his right to liberty amid criticism of police actions.
  • There are disputes between the actor's camp and police about the circumstances surrounding the stampede.
  • CCTV footage suggests Mr. Arjun received police escort, countering claims he ignored warnings.
  • Both the actor and theatre management have been charged with culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
  • The incident led to protests outside Arjun's residence, with divided public sentiment regarding his involvement.
  • The victim's husband has expressed support for the actor, indicating a willingness to withdraw the case against him.

Notable Quotes

“It was not a roadshow or procession. I just waved to people and went inside theatre.” - Allu Arjun
“I do not blame the actor for the stampede.” - Victim's Husband

The situation surrounding the stampede is complex, with ongoing inquiries and community reactions echoing the tragedy's impact on both the victims' family and the actor's public image.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Questioned by Hyderabad Police in 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case

title: Beef shortage looms in Goa as traders down shutters after clash with cow vigilantes - The Indian Express
summary:
Beef Shortage Threatens Goa as Vendors Strike After Clash with Vigilantes

Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

Goa faces a potential beef shortage as traders strike in response to harassment from cow vigilantes, following an altercation that left several vendors injured. The suppliers demand police protection amidst ongoing tensions.

  • Vendors went on strike protesting against the harassment following a clash with cow vigilantes in Margao.
  • Three meat vendors were injured during the incident, prompting safety concerns and a temporary halt in beef supply.
  • Vendors are urging the government to take action against vigilante groups and ensure police protection for transporting beef.
  • Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant emphasized the government's commitment to providing hygienic beef and warned against lawlessness.
“It is unfortunate that these vigilantes are harassing vendors while animals are transported for slaughter at the abattoir.” - Manna Bepari, President of All Goa Beef Vendors Association

This situation highlights the ongoing conflict between vendors and vigilante groups within Goa, raising concerns about food supply and safety.
newTitle: Beef Shortage Threatens Goa as Vendors Strike After Clash with Vigilantes

Explained: Centre scraps ‘no-detention policy’. Will Classes 5, 8 students fail now? - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Scraps No-Detention Policy for Classes 5 and 8: What This Means for Students

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre has ended the no-detention policy for students in Classes 5 and 8, meaning students who fail their year-end exams will no longer be automatically promoted. The policy revision allows for re-examination opportunities for those who do not meet promotion criteria.

  • The no-detention policy has been scrapped as part of the amendments to the Right to Education Act.
  • 18 states and Union Territories previously discontinued the no-detention policy.
  • Students failing their exams will receive additional instruction and a chance for re-examination within two months.
  • Teachers will assist students in identifying learning gaps during the holding period.
  • No student can be expelled from school before completing elementary education.
  • This change affects over 3,000 schools run by the central government, including Kendriya Vidyalayas.
"If the child appearing in the re-examination fails to fulfil the promotion criteria again, he shall be held back in fifth class or eighth class, as the case may be."

This significant educational policy shift focuses on improving student performance and understanding rather than rote memorization.
newTitle: India Scraps No-Detention Policy for Classes 5 and 8: What This Means for Students

title: "Fundamentally Flawed Process": Congress On Rights Panel Chief Selection - NDTV
summary:
Fundamentally Flawed Process: Congress On Rights Panel Chief Selection

Publication Date: November 30, 2024

Source: NDTV

The Congress party has expressed a strong dissent regarding the selection of Justice V Ramasubramanian as the NHRC chairperson, claiming the process was fundamentally flawed and lacked proper consultation.

  • The Congress party disagrees with the appointment made by President Droupadi Murmu.
  • Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the selection committee's process as predetermined.
  • They argue that the NHRC's inclusiveness and representation are critical for safeguarding human rights.
  • The Congress proposed alternate names for the chairperson and members, emphasizing merit and community representation.
"The NHRC's credibility and effectiveness depend on its ability to embody the diversity and inclusiveness that define India's constitutional ethos."

The Congress leaders highlighted the importance of a diverse leadership for the NHRC to effectively protect the rights of marginalized communities, raising concerns about the fairness of the selection process.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes Selection of NHRC Chairperson as Flawed

title: "Selection Process Flawed": Congress On Appointment Of Rights Panel Chief - NDTV
summary:
Congress Critiques Flawed Selection Process for NHRC Chairperson

  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge issued a dissent note regarding the selection process.
  • They criticized the process as a pre-determined exercise lacking mutual consultation and consensus.
  • The dissent highlighted the NHRC's role in safeguarding human rights, particularly for marginalized communities.
  • Congress proposed alternative candidates, emphasizing the need for inclusivity and diversity in leadership.
  • Concerns were raised over the impact of leadership representation on the NHRC's effectiveness.
“The NHRC's credibility and effectiveness depend on its ability to embody the diversity and inclusiveness that define India's constitutional ethos.”

title: 'Pre-determined exercise': Kharge, Rahul's dissent at NHRC selection panel meet - The Hindu
summary:
Kharge and Rahul Gandhi Express Dissent at NHRC Selection Process

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: [Source not provided]

This article discusses the dissent expressed by Opposition leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi regarding the selection process of the new chairperson and members of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), which they claim was fundamentally flawed.

  • Kharge and Gandhi recorded their dissent over the NHRC selection, labeling it as a "pre-determined" exercise.
  • They proposed Justice Rohinton Fali Nariman and Justice Kuttiyil Mathew Joseph for chairperson, but V. Ramasubramanian was appointed instead.
  • The NHRC chairperson position had been vacant since June 1.
  • The dissent highlights a departure from mutual consultation critical for fairness and credibility.
  • They emphasized the necessity of diversity in NHRC leadership to safeguard human rights effectively.
  • The NHRC is crucial for protecting the rights of marginalized and oppressed groups in society.
"A diverse leadership ensures that the NHRC remains sensitive to the unique challenges faced by various communities."

In conclusion, Kharge and Gandhi's dissent underscores the importance of an inclusive and fair selection process for the NHRC leadership to maintain public trust.
newTitle: Kharge and Rahul Gandhi Express Dissent at NHRC Selection Process

“The snowfall is such a beautiful sight. The weather is amazing. We didn't expect this at all…” - Hemant, a visitor from Rewari, Haryana.

The unexpected snowfall has brought joy to tourists and locals alike, reviving the tourism industry struggling since the pandemic.

title: Hospitals cannot refuse free medical treatment to rape, acid attack victims: Delhi High Court - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi High Court Mandates Free Medical Treatment for Rape and Acid Attack Victims

Published Date: December 24, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The Delhi High Court has ruled that all hospitals must provide free medical treatment to survivors of sexual violence and acid attacks, emphasizing that refusal to do so is a criminal offense.

  • Survivors must receive necessary medical treatment including first aid and diagnostic tests.
  • Complaints will be registered against medical professionals refusing treatment under Section 200 of BNS, 2023.
  • The court ordered awareness and compliance from all healthcare facilities regarding these rules.
  • A board stating that free treatment is available for such victims must be displayed in all medical facilities.
  • Those failing to comply could face up to one year in prison.
“Free out-patient and in-patient medical treatment is available for victims/ survivors of sexual assault, rape, gang rape, acid attacks, etc.”

This directive highlights the ongoing challenges faced by survivors in accessing medical care and the court's commitment to ensuring their rights are protected.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Mandates Free Medical Treatment for Rape and Acid Attack Victims

title: 'Congress Should Be Ready...': Mani Shankar Aiyar's Big Remark On INDIA Bloc Leadership - News18
summary:

Date: December 23, 2024

Former Union Minister Mani Shankar Aiyar stated that the Congress party should be prepared to relinquish its leading position in the opposition's INDIA bloc and suggested backing Mamata Banerjee for the role, citing her competence.

  • Aiyar emphasized the need for Congress to consider alternatives for leadership within the bloc.
  • He acknowledged that Rahul Gandhi would still command respect, irrespective of holding the leadership position.
  • The INDIA bloc has faced challenges following previously successful elections, highlighting the shifting dynamics within the alliance.
  • Many opposition leaders are rallying behind Banerjee for leadership due to recent electoral setbacks.
“I don’t think it’s a relevant question. I think the Congress should be ready to not be the leader of the bloc. Let whoever wants to be the leader be the leader.” - Mani Shankar Aiyar

In conclusion, Aiyar's remarks signal a potential shift in leadership dynamics within the opposition alliance as they prepare for future electoral challenges.
